name: Courtyard by Marriott Cleveland Airport/South

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel located close to the Cleveland Airport. Friendly staff and very good restaurant. The rooms were comfortable and clean. Beds were great allowing us a good night sleep. Perfect place to stay when flying out of Cleveland Ohio.
reviews.title: Good stay before flying out of Cleveland

reviews.text: I travelled to Cleveland (Strongsville), Ohio on business from April 16 to 18, and from April 30 to May 2, 2012.
reviews.title: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay. Nice room, amenities and friendly staff.

reviews.text: I stayed at Courtyard by Marriott Cleveland Airport South in Middleburg Heights, OH on both trips.
reviews.title: Price is good. Service is not.

reviews.text: Shuttle service from Cleveland-Hopkins International Airport to hotel was very prompt. On second trip, Hotel General Manager himself picked me up! Shuttle service is convenient to pick up supplies at nearby store and, to and from dinner. Shuttle drivers were very courteous, professional and pleasant.
reviews.title: Only stayed one night, but great

reviews.text: Front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. For dinner, they recommended nearby Santo’s Italian Restaurant – a family-run restaurant which offers homemade pasta dishes – exactly what I was seeking.
reviews.title: Avoid this under construction hotel until late April or May 2012

reviews.text: I've really enjoyed staying at this Courtyard in the past. And when I stay next door at the Towneplace Suites, which "offers" bland, grab-and-go food, I make a point of walking over to the Courtyard in the morning for an outstanding buffet breakfast. Omelets, potatoes, bacon, pancakes, wonderful drip coffee - they had it all.
reviews.title: Major restaurant downgrade makes me re-think Courtyards

reviews.text: After a year's absence, I am in Cleveland again, and just walked into the Courtyard. They have radically re-designed the dining room, a la the Marriott "Bistro" concept. God, what a disappointment! Gone are the elaborate, custom-made breakfasts. You get about four rigid choices (no omelets, for example). That's it. And the turkey BLT I just had for dinner was a study in overpriced mediocrity.
reviews.title: Needs some help

reviews.text: Tomorrow morning, I have nothing to look forward to - just those three or four boring choices on the overhead "menu" above the counter. No more "whatever you ask for" breakfasts in a real restaurant section and no more of that great coffee. (From now on, it's Starbuck's at Courtyard, which in my opinion make horrid drip coffee. But the marketing people must be right - after all, it's Starbuck's!)
reviews.title: Great hotel and friendly staff

reviews.text: I had noticed the "Bistro" layout at other Courtyards I've stayed at in the past year, but didn't realize it was a Marriott-wide change. That makes Courtyards a lot less desirable.
reviews.title: Excellent stay at a refurbished Courtyard

reviews.text: This is still a comfortable, pleasant hotel, with good rates. But I've got to re-think my previous commitment to Marriott now...
reviews.title: great place, friendly staff, clean rooms, but no free breakfast.

reviews.text: very nice hotel, exelent value, great service.
reviews.title: Sleep, Park, and Ride

reviews.text: Nice rooms, very clean. Spend the night, leave your vehicle, shuttle to airport. Simple call on return for pickup, safe area ! As cheap as parking in long term lots and less hassle.
reviews.title: Trip to Cleveland

reviews.text: The hotel was very clean and the staff was very helpful. The room was very nice with comfortable beds. I would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: A bit dated; great staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As with most Courtyard's this one was staffed with great folks. My only complaint is the property has become dated and really feels old and not as comfortable as updated properties.
reviews.title: Quiet and clean

reviews.text: We booked through the hotel for the Fabulous Food show and it was a package deal that included tickets to the show. We've never booked a package for a show or concert through a hotel so I was unsure if everything was going to be right. However, I have to say that the hotel exceeded our expectations! When we arrived our tickets were already printed out for us and put in an envelope along with information about their free shuttle to the show as well as a pass for parking at the location in case we chose to drive. Check in was very easy and they were very friendly. When we had a small issue with our first room, it was immediately taken care of and they didn't seem bothered or annoyed, they just fixed our issue no problem.
reviews.title: Close to the Airport

reviews.text: While visiting a local college, we stayed at this Courtyard for 3 nights, so we had ample opportunity to try it out. First the positive: the people at the front desk tried to be helpful, but were hampered by the lack of resources they had. The biggest problem with the hotel is the early 90s technology. No wi-fi in the rooms, but they say it is available in the lobby. IF you can get it to work in the lobby, it is as slow as molasses and frequently cuts out. They front desk suggested sitting nearer the router, so I cozied up to the 2 computers available in the lobby. No luck. I switched from Ipad to one of their computers and it was still terribly slow. It was a step back in time. Next up, we needed a map. Doesn't every hotel have a map of the city? No, this one doesn't. They did have directions to the rental car return that someone with the hotel had written up, Every Word Helpfully Capitalized -- Poorly Written And Just Plain Wrong To Boot. Maid service--they skipped our room. When the very nice maid knocked in mid-morning, we said "later please," she said, "okay, later" and we thought we had communicated, but we left shortly thereafter and came back late afternoon and she never came back. Oh, the climate control--not very responsive, but good enough. Breakfast buffet was $10.50, but we had egg and croissant sandwiches at the Dunkin Donuts a block or so away (delicious!) and saved ourselves about $15. The bed was comfortable, but the tv faced the side of the bed which was not the most comfortable way to watch, especially if you were the person farthest from the tv, trying to look over the intervening lump of humanity.
reviews.title: Essentially free of modern technology

reviews.text: Bottom line: keep looking for a place to stay in the area.
reviews.title: We were expecting better

reviews.text: On the surface this looks like the typical Courtyard by Marriott. We've stayed at them many times before. Several small issues, nothing terrible, skewed our view of this hotel. When we entered our "first" room, we noted hair in the bathtub. Later we tried to lock the door deadlbot and found that we were actually locked in the room. The deadbolt was stuck. One of the maintenance workers freed us, from the outside. We decided to change rooms at that point and when speaking to the desk attendant and the maintenance worker, I mentioned about the hair in the bathtub. The maintenance worker did say he would report it to housekeeping, the desk attendant seemed to have no reaction. In our second room, we noted mold and mildew in the areas where the shower was caulked. In general, areas of the bathroom were dusty and did not look well cleaned. We also found a used small towel hanging from the shower rod. The towels were thin and not of the usual quality we've found at other Marriotts. The common areas, such as the hallway carpets, did not look welll vacuumed. In summary, the hotel looked like a Courtyard, but had more of the feel of the lower budget Fairfield Inn. But I've stayed at much cleaner Fairfield Inns.
reviews.title: Solid Hotel

reviews.text: Got a deal on this for a one-night stay. Most everything was average across the board, except the front desk. They were great. Unfortunately, I had a bad a/c unit in my first room that sounded like a jet taking off whenever it started. When I called to see about another room, the front desk was friendly and helpful, told me to come right down, and had a new room key waiting for me by the time I got there. The new room was adequate, though it did not have a refrigerator as the old room did. Decent location, with a variety of dinner options available.
reviews.title: Perfect for our needs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here to attend a local Irish festival. Have stayed at several of the other area hotels, this had the best rooms, the nicest breakfast area (you do pay for the meal, but it's quite good so worth it). We were placed on thee ground floor and at first wondered why until we realized that the upper floors were filled with girls soccer teams and thus noisy. Thanks to the management for recognizing this.
reviews.title: Great park, sleep, and fly option

aka: Courtyard By Marriott Cleveland Airport/South Hotel
